page.title: 11HEALTH - HEDINGHAM
page.content: There is a doctor's surgery in St. James Street run by two doctors in partnership. Approx. 30 people visit the surgery each day , and 15 prescriptions are dispensed. The doctors make house calls each day and about Â£10,000 worth of drugs is kept at the surgery. A baby and infant clinic is held twice monthly in Sible Hedingham Village Hall which is well attended. Aids for disabled people and for home nursing are available in the village. A chiropodist occasionally visits the pensioner's club which is held on Friday afternoons. Hospital visits present some difficulties because of the distances involved (at least 5 miles to Halstead or 20 miles to Colchester), especially in emergencies or accidents.
